entry.title: Untitled2
entry.content:
出于对公司的安全规范标准考虑，我决定在上下班途中将耳机收起来以便提升对于周边的警觉性。但是这并没有持续很久。同样的列车，同样的道路，甚至连路上的人都开始变得眼熟，不知道对方是不是也是这么想的。受不了机器人般的电车广播后，我决定带上了耳机，隔绝周围的声音，将自己围绕在一座围墙里行走。
仅仅两个星期我就打破了公司的安全守则（当然，进入公司的时候我还是会将耳机摘掉），那么我身边在日本长期工作的上班族呢，他们是否也是跟我用有一样的想法，每天上班途中就把耳机戴上，听着没有意义的音乐，看着根本不会进入记忆里的文章，消磨着时间呢。
戴上耳机意味着什么呢，是不是就是撞到了别人只需假装什么事也没发生么。如果每个人都戴上耳机，那是不是真的就什么事都没发生。

entry.title: Update 7/28
entry.content:
Sorry that I stopped posting for a while. There is always an urge in me to write a blog post, a story, or just simply posting a picture, but when I actually sit down in front of my computer ready to knock on my keyboard, it goes away. But this is not an apology letter.

On the trip around Seto Inland Sea islands:
We, or at least me, always tend to overestimate oneself. In this case, I overestimated my fitness strength and underestimated the cycling route around the island. A late realization of forgetting the tripod mount, a gloomy start of the trip kicked in, having to carry extra kilograms of a useless material. The wind from the sea certainly felt nice and it has been a long time since I witnessed scenes of the seaside. But it was a fight with the sun; as I try to hide in every shade I could, the sun replied back with a stronger emission… burning my skin at the end.

I used to claim that everything is art. Well, I still stand by my point, but I still am not able to justify myself yet. But if anyone wants to ask me why, I would kindly invite them to this trip, and perhaps after that, they would feel the same.
Have you ever watched the rain drops on a car window (or any window, if you never been on a car) racing down from the top to bottom? A long walk to Teshima Modern Art Museum brings that back to you, in the form of art. It was the weirdest museum I have ever seen. A semi-egg shaped with two ovals cut out, the building consisted of only a few holes on the ground and some water droplets. Yes, anyone would feel robbed on the first sight, or perhaps even forever, but the museum definitely defined art and nature. I won’t mention the architecture because I have no clue about the field, but the feeling the building gives off to people inside, and how the trees and the grasshoppers integrated into the building was art. It does not have to be fancy paint strokes with vibrant colours to be an artwork. Afterall, you feel it, not look at it.

entry.title: Dream is a love
entry.content:
1.

150 meters away, 2 seconds, I knew exactly when it will be here. The revebrating sound of metals could be heard, changing its pitch as it approached, singing a nightingale’s tale. A chill breeze of wind followed, relieving the summer heat. But they do not last long. 150 seconds, another 24 hours until the next train.
I was a letter boy, and the train station with that train was part of my delivery route everyday. Rather, I made it part of the route. It must had been a long distance train, since I could hear it a block away. It must had also been the most captivating voice, since it took my thought away from hunger.
Was anyone watching me? I didn’t think so. Even if there were, did it matter? Most likely not. Yet, I didn’t look at it until two weeks later, afraid that I would be like everybody else who would turn their head as soon as they hear that voice. But who could resist at the end of the day? Even from a block away, the train looked exquisite, something special. The curvature of it reflected the sun at the perfect spot. It was like listening to Liebesträume with my eyes closed, only to find it was Franz Lizst playing the entire time.
One is allured to as close as he can be. Day by day, I moved closer to it, walking towards it, even if the sun would melt my wings. I felt close to it, as if I was part of it. I told myself that no one else in the world knew it better than I did. We were close, yet even at its vicinity I felt distanced, perhaps further than where I was before. For 90 seconds the world would light around me and bring me delight. And then it would be gone. The faint diesel smell surrounded me, and I would be in solitude. For the briefest moment, I would be the happiest boy around, and for the longest time, I would be a seagull left behind at migration, not knowing where to go.

2.

entry.title: Predeparture
entry.content:
写在临走前 -
回到家休息10天后，接下来迎接我的就是10个星期的实习生活。虽然一直很喜欢去日本旅游，但是在那里生活、工作却会是完全不一样的体验。期待又焦虑着，还有几个小时就要离开了。
有些事情来的很突然，虽然失望，但也只能叹息。就如读完一本心爱的书一样，不管再怎么拖，总是要翻到最后一页的。

有空我会整理一下暑假的笔记。

Written with StackEdit.

entry.title: Marginal Competition
entry.content:
Marginal Competition

我不是最顶端的那一波人，而往往成功与失败只差了一道题。虽然看似很容易，但其实是一个很大的坎。

今天对我来说一位重要的友人离开了（短暂的还是长期的目前还不确定），虽然五味杂陈，但有时候一个人带来的solitary （找不到合适的中文字来形容）还是挺有意思的。
漫无目的上了公车，顺便补了觉后从legion of honour开始逛起。

菲戈的猪头？

在最近的公车站上了车后发现附近有个动物园，就过去看了。动物园总是一个很奇怪的地方，但是鉴于我对动物园的看法实在是太中二了，我在此保留我的看法。


在4只猪里面，有两只选择了为食物争吵，一只看戏，还有一只或许就是那只特立独行的猪吧。

大一一下就结束了，但是并没有让自己感到满意，也没有成为自己想要成为的人。如果连自己擅长的都把握不了，而且在乎的也留不住，那做的的确有点失败。
—写在心爱的友人（差点）离开后。

Written with StackEdit.

entry.title: Freshman Year
entry.content:
一年前的今天，天气也是很好。那时候甚至每天都会看着天气预报期望着明天是晴天，毕竟没有人想在雨中约会。
今年的今天，考完final的第三天在宿舍中看着电脑屏幕，觉得没有负担、没有压力、不用学习的日子还真挺无聊的。一年前的今天，根本不想学习。
虽然我经常吐槽我们学校，但是还是觉得如果当初选择了另一所学校，我的生活只会更糟。
离开了待了7年的温哥华才发现我一直以来都是过着皇帝的生活。我很讨厌Durant Ave的垃圾跟骚味，但是其实这才是常态。看着路上的车子从清一色的奔驰到丰田，我才发现我以前的努力根本不算努力。我对世界一无所知。
感谢我在这里遇到了我的朋友们。

关于学业：
我第一年的成绩不能算理想吧，不过我原本就没有我想的那么厉害，所以也算过得去。在高中数学课划水了3年后才发现在大学划水就等于吃C。感谢53的第一个midterm把我打醒，也感谢53教会我什么叫学习。
有点失望的是化学课，尽管教授跟GSI的确很菜（教学水平方面），但问题本身还是在我身上，希望明年能够更好吧。
7B是我比较喜欢的一门课，尽管非常玄学（感觉物理永远复习不完）。学完不仅发现我高中学的物理根本不算物理而且还发现原来53是真的有用的。
E7是一门很实用的课，MATLAB学了不会亏。不过听说秋季的教授很可耻。
两个学期以来，我学到了很多，但你要叫我一个一个列出来我学到的知识，其实也没那么多。四年后我到底能学到多少，我也不知道。

关于其他：
我高中第三年的时候因为种种原因停止了踢球。开学后我认识了一群喜欢足球的中国人并一起组了一个球队，这或许是我第一年最美好的回忆。感谢所有陪我踢球的人。在此特别提名一下Hubert 学长；麻烦你一直以来组织各种活动了。

我也不知道这个网站能活多久，或许会跟我高中弄的公众号一样从周更到月更到年更到现在的不更吧。
我写的很差，中文已经很久很久没有接受过教育了。
谢谢阅读。

传说中的月食 – viewed from Residence Hall Unit 1

Written with StackEdit.
